text: Bent thumb or not? Let your arm hang at your side. What is the shape of your thumb? That's what it should be. Bending adds tension. #bowhold
Key to comfortable bow hold...lifting bow to the palm, then moving it parallel down to string.Feeling it resting in the hand not on string.
Bow movements:paintbrush, seesaw & eraser motions...Keys for normal playing, spiccato & sautille(&fast detache). All native instincts #cello
After many past concerts at Carnegie Hall, I spoke & heard my arrangements played for 1st time last night. Wonderful experience. #carnegie
Cello tip...Knuckles should turn white & bend on up bow, not the wrist. Common mistake.Like attaching hairs of paintbrush above the handle.
Dounis Masterclass Dec11-12 3-5PM- Cottle School 2 Siwanoy Blvd, EastchesterNY...Intro to Dounis Methods w/ Byron Duckwall. 2days/4hrs
I'm always amazed at the instant increase in expression when impulses come fr the hands not the arms. #cellotips

Dounis conquered nerves by giving his students many details to focus on, not allowing room for negative thoughts to arise.
Played wonderful concert w friends Tamarind and Naamleela...Bach and Beethoven. Packed house...very moving. #mtc http://t.co/k7wLRzKOCj
When touching a smooth surface what do the fingers do just before touching the surface? Imitate this approaching the string. #bestcellotips
A secret of the bow is approaching the string as a smooth surface. Try touching the tailpiece then imitating that on string. #bestcellotips
Remember the knuckles are the point of flexibility in the brush stroke, not the wrist. Don't try to substitute one for the other!
The pivot of the thumb & 2nd finger is key in the bow hold...esp for the brush stroke– also for comfort, flexibility & function altogether.
What is the cause of all your string playing problems? The answer is in this post, & how to discover ur genius. http://t.co/NWG79nrN6z
The bow hold is of utmost importance & the secret is the bow must feel weightless in the hand. Balance, flexibility & strength are the keys.

Expression &  Ease are linked. If it feels easy, expression comes out naturally, but expression is senior & should be the basis of playing.
#bestcellotips Lifting fingers is more important than dropping. Focus on the lift beginning of each group of fast notes & see the results.
@CelloFact did u know Feuermann didn't like his recording of Haydn D major?  He thought the orch was inferior quality. @cello @violin
Vibrato tip-arm is light & all joints are mobile including wrist.Finger is balanced, & only vibrato finger is on the string. #bestcellotips
The vibrato is the basis of the LH technique not just an "add on" for expression. #bestcellotips #cello
A big secret of the bow is to hold it without grabbing it. The trick is it must feel weightless. #Bestcellotips #cello

Shifting down(eg 1-4)LH contracts & the new finger pushes the old out of the way.Learning to contract LH is often overlooked. #bestcellotips

Xmas Tip-Find natural grip by bringing RH  to a normal pos. w/out bow, dangle hand, then bring the bow into the naturally suspended hand.
TOTD (tipoftheday) Play as if on an imaginary string half an inch above the actual string. Try it and tell me the effect.#cello #violin
